body_html:
No, what I meant was for ubuntu 14, binaries can be built on ubuntu 14 for ubuntu 14.
We still have CI systems that have ubuntu 14 installed, and TF passes all tests ubuntu 14, too.

In the future, when some of our plans land this will be averted because we will have distribution systems that will check host OS and hardware, but at the moment pip does not offer much.
body_text:
No, what I meant was for ubuntu 14, binaries can be built on ubuntu 14 for ubuntu 14.
We still have CI systems that have ubuntu 14 installed, and TF passes all tests ubuntu 14, too.
In the future, when some of our plans land this will be averted because we will have distribution systems that will check host OS and hardware, but at the moment pip does not offer much.
body:
No, what I meant was for ubuntu 14, binaries can be built on ubuntu 14 for ubuntu 14.
We still have CI systems that have ubuntu 14 installed, and TF passes all tests ubuntu 14, too.

In the future, when some of our plans land this will be averted because we will have distribution systems that will check host OS and hardware, but at the moment pip does not offer much.
